name: InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino

reviews.text: We just returned from staying at the Intercontinental. This was our first trip to PR and this is one of the best trips ever! The hotel was beautiful and the staff, no matter where, were very accommodating! We met so many nice people from all over the U.S. We were complimentary upgraded to an oceanfront room on the 15th floor so the view was breathtaking! The bed faces the window so waking up to the view each morning was more than I could ask for! Yes, the Intercontinental is a little expensive -for drinks mainly but we went to the store and bought our own and kept it in the room. Dinners were great - we ate at the Momoyama and the cost was no more than what we pay back home to go to dinner. We went across the street to the little strip mall to have breakfast which was very good also. One day we ate breakfast at the Ponderosa which was surprisingly good too!
reviews.title: Great Stay!
Intercontential Hotel good & bad............
reviews.text: We took the Old San Juan tour and the Bacardi tour and they were both fun - not enough time in Old San Juan but we went back the next night and it was just wonderful!! Outside vendors, music and dancing in the streets, outdoor cafes, etc. We did not take the bus to town since we didn't want to be on it for over an hour for a 15 min. ride by taxi - there were four of us so we split the cost - it was much more convenient. This is a fabulous place - I can't wait to return!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.title: great hotel
reviews.text: My expectations were not what I was expecting. I was upgraded because of my club membership. Unfortunately, My room was located on the city side. I felt like I was not away from home since I come from the city. At night I could hear the planes go by for landing. The A.C. was making noise too. The next day, I asked to change my room to the beach side. Of course they wanted more money. I refuse to pay. I told them I cannot sleep at night and I was not spending another night there. I finaly asked to speak to the Mgr. I was given another room with a pool view. I was downgraded to one room but the room was sunny and had a nice view and I felt like I was on vacation. I inspected the room first before I decided to accept. The pool was big and nice.

The ocean is the Atlantic ocean, so it isn't beautiful and clear like the Carribean. The beach is big compare to other beaches in P.R. The hotel is old but clean. The staff are alright. The resturants are good but expensive. If you venture out get ready for the hassles of waiting .
reviews.title: Great Location and a great beach

reviews.text: Great place to stay.The noise that some people talked about ,I never heard it. Sure some doors closed loud but was not an issue.The hotel staff was very helpful.The avis center in the hotel was very helpful.If you are goingto be there 4 plus days I would suggest renting a car for at least one day.Now they drive crazy but its not where you cant handle it.The casino is just that a casino.You can win or you can loose your money.The jet ski rental was cool.The food has expensive at the hotel,but across the srteet and down the street you can find great food for less. Over all I would stay at th IC again .
reviews.title: So So Resort

reviews.text: I had a great time staying here! The hotel is what "made" my vacation... I never would've had as great a time had I stayed somewhere else. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. They even gave us little tricks on saving money (like taking the ferry from the Bacardi factory to Old San Juan instead of a taxi). They always made sure we were safe and answered any questions we had. They also upgraded our room from a city-view to an oceanview because ours wasn't ready yet! Also, we lost our hotel voucher, so they called AA Vacations and got another copy for us, with no hassle at all. It definitely lived up to its great reputation. While not everyone has a great experience everywhere, all of the time, this hotel was much better than some of the reviews on this site would lead you to believe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone & everyone, and would only return to San Juan if I could stay at the Intercontinental!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

likes.disliked: — Pool is dimly-lit at night (but that's not really a bad thing all of the time!)

reviews.title: It is what it is
reviews.text: My college-age daughters and I were looking for a fast and easy get-away for some well-deserved R&R . Our stay was: Thursday to Monday over St. Patrick's Day weekend. San Juan is a relatively quick and direct flight from NJ, no passports required, so off we went. Upon arrival, it seemed to me that San Juan is still caught in the 1960's and has never really progressed into the new millenium., I was there in 1968 and it all looked exactly the same. The hotel was 10 minutes from the airport, so expect lots of air-traffic noise, but you travel to the resort quickly by cab, so no long uncomfortable van rides. Our room was average-to-below average in size and style, but was clean.and did not smell. Although we had "run of the house" we ended up facing the street on the 7th floor. The landing path for air traffic.was our "view". We only stayed in our room to sleep, so it wasn't the end of the world, however I do enjoy hearing the waves at night through open windows when staying at an ocean-side resort. and missed that feature. There is a wing of newer rooms that looked really nice, all facing the pool area. Apparenlty these were fully booked when we were there. If you have a cloice and the budget, book one of them.

The weather was perfect everyday. The beach, however, is called the Emerald Isle for a specific reason: the green seaweed. The beach, in my opinion, is unswimmable and also smelly due to the seaweed drying in the sun, so it is not even very walkable. The seaweed extends the full length of the beach, well-beyond the hotel's boundaries. If you want a beautiful beach and like to swim in the ocean, don't go here. The pool was lovely. There is one small area that is deep for swimming, the other areas are about 3' deep. Lots of little waterfalls (great for aqua massage) and a swim-up bar. The bar served well-made and strong, albeit expensive, drinks. If you plan on eating and drinking solely in the hotel figure on spending quite a lot of money ( hot breakfast for 3 averaged $70; lunch, with drinks $100; dinners was always in excess of $100, with the exception of the sushi house, where my one daughter and I had maki rolls, wine and dessert one evening for under $50.). A Walgreen's (open 24/7) down the street ( within easy walking distance) sells spring water, I'd suggest you stock up, unless you want to pay $4 for an 8oz bottle. Lots of fast food type places are within easy walking distance. We did not go to any of them.
reviews.title: Reservations PROBLEMS
Great stay, they do a nice job!
reviews.text: The staff at the hotel was wonderful. Always ready to assist. We prefer iced coffee in the mornings and the wait-staff made sure we had it just to our liking every morning. The concierge service was exceptionally helpful and kind. If my goal had been a luxurious beachy Caribbean vacation...this would not be the place to go. We wanted quick and easy 4 days in the sun by a pool with good drinks and a pool-side lounge to sit and read on, comfortable enough to encourage naps. For this purpose: the Intercontinental was perfect. It was also spring-break and the hotel was NOT filled with rowdy party kids: a plus. We did go to Ajillo Mojillo for traditional Puerto Rican cuisine and it was really good, but know in advance that one entree can easily serve two people and the sangria is very sweet. They make an excellent Mojito.

reviews.title: Wonderful place, nice staff, great location, beautiful beach.
reviews.text: The El San Juan right next door to the Intercontinental has quite an impressive lobby and bar and an interesting little network of shops...worth a quick trip to explore if you get bored.

We stayed at the Intercontinental at the beginning of December of 2011. It was our first vacation in over 3 years and chose this hotel because we had stayed at the intercontinental in the Papeete and had a fantastic time. However, this place is outdated, our first room had mold in the bathroom and the carpet was dirty. The bathroom looked like they had used a wet towel to clean the whole room and no cleaning detergent was used. They moved us to another room that was better but the carpet was still dirty. We were there for a total of 5 nights and on the last night we were awaken by the police arresting someone on our hallway. Obviously the hotel can't control people's behavior but there was blood all over the elevator and dripping down the balcony from the 15th floor the following morning when we were leaving. When we told the front desk person, she seemed uninterested. We will never stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Dissapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located on one of the best beaches in the Carolina area of San Juan Puerto Rico. The hotel has gorgeous grounds, beach bar, lots of lounges with umbrellas surrounding a lagoon like pool with a little "island" and waterfall. It is not far from the airport and has a bus stop almost right in front that serves Old San Juan buses that are very inexpensive. Senior rate for a ride is only 35 Cents. Bus 53 takes you right to the bus station in the Old City. You can then take a free trolley from there to the many tourist stops in the Old City. There are a few local restaurants just a few blocks from the hotel. The food in the hotel is ridiculously expensive, so unless you wish to spend your vacation dollars there, take a little walk or go into Old San Juan where you can get some great cuisine for very little money. The rooms are nicely appointed, but the bathroom was pretty small and average for such an expensive place. Beds and linens are the typical Holiday Inn improved bedding--very comfortable and crisp, clean sheets. Ask for a room facing the pool and beach area. We were only at the hotel for one night prior to a southeastern Caribbean cruise. Unfortunately, the hotel is quite a distance from the port area, which is in Old San Juan, so you need to take a $25 dollar or more Taxi ride if you have any luggage, as the buses really are not equipped to handle luggage. Better to stay in Old San Juan if you are taking a cruise. The hotel has a large casino, but we did not gamble, so not sure just how large or nice it is. We ate at a little restaurant almost across from the hotel which was inexpensive and very good. Cannot remember the name, however. The hotel was a nice place to relax and enjoy the beach and pool area, however, even if for a short time. We had extended check-out, so had a bit of time to enjoy the place before our ride to the cruise ship in the afternoon.
reviews.title: Lovely old hotel right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 4 days here on a very rare vacation without the kids. I used some priority club certificates for the stay, so I really didn't know what to expect. However, I ended up being very impressed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel- Wonderful time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's talk location first. I'd give that a solid 7 out of 10. It is right next to the airport- almost within walking distance. That being said, it certainly isn't an airport hotel. It is right on the beach and it good company. There is a Ritz Carlton and a Waldorf on the same stretch of beach. There aren't many restaurants except for those in the hotels nearby. We tried a few of these and found the food wonderful but overpriced. My favorite meal of the trip was the first night when we ate at the Intercontinental restaurant that is literally on the beach (the table was in the sand). The food was great. There weren't a lot of good routes to run if you're into that sort of thing, but the beach always works. Old San Juan- a place you definitely need to spend some time in- was about 10-15 minutes away. Its got great restaurants, touristy shopping, and historic sites.
reviews.title: Good Hotel & Location

reviews.text: We went there one full day and also spent a full day in the rainforest, about 45 minutes away.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay after cruise

reviews.text: Just spent five days at the Intercontinental and had an excellent experience. Hotel itself is 3.5-4 stars, staff is excellent, food is over priced but where isn't it on an island. Be clear this is not a Four Seasons or a Ritz; but it provides an enjoyable vacation complete with the amenities which most of us expect. Beach is pretty but seaweed is a problem near the shoreline; venture out a bit and it goes away. Pools are very nice and well kept. Expect the beach to be pristine and beautiful as can be and you're setting yourself up for disappointment. Restaurants are good, location is central to other activites. I'd recommend renting a car for sightseeing. Price is right; enjoy.
reviews.title: Enjoyed this hotel

reviews.text: Spent a week in Isla Verde with my wife and teenage daughters in a ocean view room at the Intercontinental. Hotel was centrally located for day trips around Puerto Rico and its facilities were all first rate. Beautiful large pool (get there early before the chairs are all taken), right on the beach (water was perfect for swimming once you moved left or right of the seaweed), clean rooms and public areas, inviting restaurants. Choice of two low-key restaurants right at beach/pool which are perfect settings for lunch in a bathing suit. Hotel staff was unfailingly friendly, helpful and polite. Surrounding area has both fine and casual restaurants, supermarkets, chain drugstores, and fast food joints galore - very convenient and good for strolling day or night. Very visible police presence that makes vistors feel safe. Puerto Rico itself is an incredibly beautiful place. Rent a car and go exploring (but don't expect well marked roads once you leave the main highways). Old San Juan alone is worth at least a couple of days and nights. Can't wait to go back to Puerto Rico and the Intercontinental.
reviews.title: Great Base For Exploring Puerto Rico

likes.disliked: — Get more waitresses in the casino!

reviews.text: The airlines put me up at the Intercontinental after a missed connection so - obviously - I had not planned to stay at this hotel, nor in San Juan at all. Lucky for me, the 24 hrs I spent at this hotel turned out to be the of my larger Caribbean vacation. The staff
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience & perfect getaway

likes.liked: — The pool and the location on the beach, as well as all the many dining options on the property.
likes.disliked: — They charge guests to use the internet in the business center.

reviews.text: was wonderful, polite and accomodating. The pool was beautiful and well-maintained and there was someone ready to set out a chaise on the beach for me when I wanted to soak in the ocean instead. There is

Not sure where the negative people stayed but I know I stayed at the InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa & Casino. It would be really helpful if people rated a hotel, service and their overall stay with a little more objectivity.
reviews.title: A great time in PR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 8 days and 7 nights at the IC and had a wonderful time. Here's my objective ratings based upon numerous stays at hotels ranging from the Four Seasons to Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: ICH San Juan shouldn't be part of the ICH group of hotels!
Great vacation spot...
reviews.text: The InterContinental San Juan Resort, Spa & Casino is not a Four Seasons but then again I did not pay Four Seasons rates. It also not a Holiday inn Express - the IC is much better.

reviews.title: second visit just as good
reviews.text: The reasons people go to the Caribbean - sun and fun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Weather 4.5 stars - rained one day with a few showers on two other days (no big deal). Other than that the weather was outstanding - not too hot just right.
reviews.title: Wish we were back at the San Juan IC right now ! !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Puerto Rico is one of my favorite destinations when looking for some beautiful beaches and surf. I stayed for the first time at the Intercontinental in 2010. The beach is very well kept and the porters are there to bring your beach chairs wherever you would like. It was expensive, yes they charge $20 a DAY for internet service, $8 for a bottle of water, and the breakfast buffet cost you $50 at minimum per day (for breakfast!). Given the fact that I loved the beach, and the convenience of being able to walk to the Starbucks next door at the ESJ and down to Pueblo for some room snacks, water, etc., I thought that I was making the best out of it. At the end of this trip, my boyfriend and I purchased their Ambassador Club membership. We were told this includes a free night stay, a free room upgrade and complimnetary water and fruit daily in your room, to use at each participating hotel. We ended up spending more than we hoped with the nickel and dime approach (coffee in the hotel bar was $5 a cup after tip). We did go back last year, 2011 and will NOT GO BACK AGAIN. First, they refused to honor our free night certificate, saying that we didnt book thru the proper office. I spoke to the Ambassador Club rep for booking directly for this reason and was told what I had to do to retrieve the certificate. They would not honor it. They also would not upgrade our room, nor compensate us for the difference. The front desk staff are rude and will make you wait while they ingnore you and continue typing or speaking to another rep. We left the front desk after feeling defeated and went to our room. This started the trip off on a bad footing. We then proceeded to continue to spend $50+ a day for breakfast (you dont have a choice, there isnt another breakfast place). My boyfriend had the full buffett which was about $28ish, while my appetite choose the continental breakfast which was a choice of 3-4 pastries and oatmeal for a whopping $18ish. We continued to head over to Pueblo every couple of days to buy a case of bottled water and snacks for the beach. After this trip, we will NOT go back again. I do love Puerto Rico, and this year, I will be looking into a private rental!
reviews.title: Going downhill...

reviews.text: Our flight was significantly delayed so we took a short cab ride here to while away the time and enjoyed a good breakfast on the patio near the pool. The staff were pleasant and the pool area was nice, it was not crowded and the property was very clean. We walked next door to the San Juan resort and, by comparison, it was very dark (although the lobby area is attractive) and staff were less friendly.
reviews.title: Nice place for leisurely breakfast near pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked pretty late for this trip. I had wanted to be in El Convento in Old San Juan but could not get a room. When we arrived, we found out why - it was the weekend of the San Sebastiano festival. This is an annual festival which packs a mardi gras sized celebration into a pretty small area. So we were quite lucky to be in Isla Verde. The hotel was originally designed by Morris Lapidus, but it has been updated and is quite beautiful. We were happy to have paid for an ocean-view room. The room was very large, comfortable and immaculate. The staff was accommodating and we recommend the place highly. We did not eat in the hotel at all (we normally do not) and the concierge was gracious about recommending places we could walk to.
reviews.title: Great location, pool, beach

reviews.text: The property shows it's age. The rooms are neat and clean and show signs of age. The view to the ocean is striking. The neighborhood could be better. If you are happy with the price and you're not looking for a *** or **** hotel, this hotel may work for you. Ruth's Chris Steakhouse restaurant is on property.
reviews.title: Nice...but a bit elderly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed 4 nights at the end of Jan. and we were very happy with the hotel. The beds were heavenly - best hotel sleep we have ever had! Service was top notch. We spent every day at the beach lounging on the free beach chairs. One day we bought an umbrella for $10.00 but if you pull your chair up to the shade of the trees by the beach bar, that works just as well. The beach bar food is fantastic and so is the food from Room Service. (Yes, pricey but easily shared by two!) We didn't eat at the main hotel restaurants but did notice they had Early Bird Specials at pretty reasonable prices. For breakfast, we ordered a la carte and didn't have the big buffet. The Continental Breakfast was also a mini buffet with cereal, yogurt, bagels, sweet rolls, fresh fruit and more. We did go across the street to Mi Casa for one breakfast, like some folks recommended. We weren't impressed. We took the local bus into San Juan ( instead of the $21.00 taxi ride) and it took about 1/2 hour and cost 75 cents; plenty of seats in the morning. My only suggestions to the hotel for improvement: the pool is too cold, the jacuzzi is not hot enough, and the music at the pool is too loud. One last note for those thinking of going to the Intercontinental: If you are a bit overweight and worried about wearing a swimsuit, no worries here - so if everyone else!
reviews.title: Above Expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took a five-day weekend trip to Puerto Rico for our 8th wedding anniversary and loved our stay at the Intercontinental San Juan.
reviews.title: Just what we were looking for - relaxing but still close to it all

reviews.text: Welcomed in by the friendly staff, we kicked back on some days and adventured on others, and this hotel perfectly fit our needs and style.
reviews.title: Diversity at its best, luxury within reach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool environment is relaxing and has a great mix of sunny and less-sunny spots, with a terrific layout. The restaurants are of above-average quality and a wide variety, and if you're not satisfied here, the Isla Verde area is full of spots in every price range. The breakfast buffet staff has the best mix of speed and friendliness I've ever seen.
reviews.title: Smiling Faces

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nestor, the head concierge, is a delight and is connected to everyone on the island. While we were there, he helped a young man pull off a marriage proposal to his love. And for us, he helped plan a memorable visit to Old San Juan, a bioluminescent bay tour in Fajardo, and dinner at spectacular Caribbean-French fusion restaurant Marmalade -- each one, a total winner.
reviews.title: Clean room, friendly staff, 24hr pool access!

reviews.text: The hotel was going through renovations during our September 2013 visit, but the staff kept disruptions to a minimum.
reviews.title: Very clean and friendly hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I came here for our first anniversary this past weekend. Upon arriving we were pleased to find the hotel facilities to be relatively clean and up date. Cheap Carribean, the company we booked through saw to it that we got an ocean view room which was great and the hotel even sent up strawberries and champagne ( either that or it was our friends). The our experience went downhill - we went to the pool bar and the drinks and food were off ( we thought maybe this is how piña coladas and chicken wraps may taste in pr) but realized when went to the other hotels and restaurants that the food was just off at intercontinental - microwaved and watered down like. No matter we thought. We can just eat at other hotels and outside restaurants. Then our first night came and went - no housekeeping. We called and asked them to clean the room and they said sure we will come up. Someone brought towels and then left. We called again and they said that they were not coming to clean the room, it was too late.... And this was pretty much their attitude the rest of the time there. We asked for information on tours and the lady at the front desk concierge ( short grey hair drawn on eyebrows) acted like we were dummies for not knowing different parts of the island, was impatient w her answers as though she didn't want to help us and oddly didn'tet us have one of the free maps she was showing us things on until we asked for it??? Again I thought this was my imagination and the another day as we were boarding a van to go Oma rainforest tour, she sarcastically snarled "please take your time" as we dashed for the van.
reviews.title: Don't stay here - nice facilities, but rude customer service and gross food.

reviews.text: And here comes the best part - the hotel granted us a 2:30 late checkout on our last day so we could do a rainforest tour. Nice of them right? We came back for our 5 hour tour hot and sticky and of course needed to take showers to check out only to find NO WATER in the room after soaping up. My husband called to ask what to do because we were close to the 2:30 deadline and the front desk offered to let us use the hospitality suite on another floor. We dashed down there and the key didn't work. So we went back to our original room and called to tell them we could not access the hospitality suite. No response. We went down to the lobby clothes on, soap still on because there was no water and the front desk didn't seem concerned - they just offered us the hospitality suite again. I get that this was an unplanned water outage - but it's the construction that they are doing that caused it and it would have been nice if the manager had offered us a couple of few extra minutes so we would not have had to rush down there with our clothes on and soap underneath to find a solution I the lobby .... Common sense. You inconvenience a customer, you give them the courtesy of a few extra minutes instead of making them around from floor soapy and sticky so that they can make your checkout time.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Honestly we would not have gone on the tour or accepted a late checkout if we knew that the staffs customer service water and Internet ended at 12 pm.
reviews.title: Crappy staff

reviews.text: Don't go there - the staff has a clueless that's the way it is attitude. I want the money for my last night back - between housecleaning and water issues - the hotel made us feel rather stupid for staying there
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. Loved the pool, which is also open 24 hours! The service was great, and the rooms were incredibly clean. The only downside was the location. It's a bit far from downtown San Juan, so if you're planning on going into the downtown area/old San Juan, expect to take a cab because it's definitely out of walking range. The beach was awesome, as you have your own private access. Overall, I would recommend this incredible hotel to anyone staying in the San Juan area.
reviews.title: Great stay!!!

reviews.text: We're in PR as we speak and I just had to post! Don't believe the negative reviews! It's great at the IC. Hotel provides more than adequate accommadations in a GREAT location. We are active. . .Walked the entire beach daily, went into the RITZ (beautiful but snobby), El San Juan (live salsa at night, great for people watching-- have to see lobby, right next door), The Water Club (roof top bar, sushi, great!) and more. Driving is aggressive but not bad. Got a car yesterday and did the rainforest, Laquillo and Old San Juan. WHEW! Great new Italian restaurant (Sofia, owned by Parrot Club guy, Marco at bar A+!!) Had so much fun, we'r keeping the car today too! Online getting more info form foruns to decide where to go next! Friendly people here. A retired woman just struck up conversation with us yesterday in Old San Juan. She told us about the history of the buildings, La Princesa (the old prison) and the military buildings! It was great. Mind the pigeons~
reviews.title: Here right now!

reviews.text: You have to explore this great island! Book the IC! You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation
Great Location, Great Beach/Pool
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Intercontinental from June 26th to 30th. We had a GREAT time. Everyone says the Intercontinental is pricey, but we got a really good package deal with a garden/pool view, and none of these "hidden" fees people keep talking about . We ended up on the 6th floor and you could still see the ocean.

reviews.title: Great stay
reviews.text: Definitely get an oceanview room if you stay, like everyone says. We had a hospitality room when we arrived on the city side. No comparison. Also when we left we received a hospitality room on the 16th floor ocean view...WOW! I see why its the "higher" the better. You could see the whole beach and beyond from this room. It was just gorgeous. I saw nothing wrong with the lobby, I thought the hotel was very nice and clean, and the grounds were beautiful. The pool was really nice (and clean) too, although we are beach people and never went in!

Food is what everyone says, expensive at the hotel (but good!), and so many ways to work around this. We went to Mi Casita for many inexpensive meals and thought it was great. Metropol (for cuban) is also just a short walk away. The location of this hotel was excellent. On one of the days we rented a car and drove ourselves to Old San Juan, defintely worth the short trip to this beautiful city. Then we drove to Fajardo and did the kayak bio bay tour. Also DEFINTITELY worth it, a once in a lifetime experience.
reviews.title: Perfect location! Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice hotel right on the beach. The pool is especially nice as is the hot tub. The beach restaurant is convinient and the gym is decent which faces the ocean. The location is close to the airport but far from old san juan. For the price, this hotel is a good option. No major flaws except for one. Internet. Not only is it 20 dollars per day for internet, but it's 20 dollars PER DEVICE for the internet. So if you want your phone and ipad both to have internet access it will cost you $40 per day. Why not do your customers a favor and just include internet in the price of the room? If it weren't for this problem we could consider coming back to this hotel again and again.
reviews.title: $ for EACH DEVICE on internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely resort... But hang onto your wallet. Fees for just about everything. From the $8 bottle of water left in the room for our "convenience," to the $10 sheepishly requested to rent what looked like a Walmart beach umbrella, to the ridiculously overpriced Internet service ($16.95 for 'basic' and 19.95 for 'premium' high speed) ... I felt not like a guest but a walking ATM machine. If I were paying full price like most guests... And not the bargoon Hotwire blind rate... I would have been outraged. The beach is lovely though, the rooms comfortable and the staff were terrific. I didn't like Isla Verde much however. It's one huge ugly strip lined with tacky fast food joints and half empty, 60s era shopping plazas. Recommended restaurants nearby: Mi Casita across the street for breakfast and lunch. Metropole (about 100 yards to the left of the hotel exit) for fantastic and reasonably priced Cuban/Puerto Rican food. Both are local favorites. Bottom line: if you are going to San Juan, have to be on the beach and can get a good deal on this hotel... It's a good place to stay. Next time though I'll stay in Old San Juan.
reviews.title: Fees, fees, fees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are good and not so good points about this hotel. Hotel is located just 5 minutes from the airport, although the area it is located on is a bit run down. Good size rooms, clean and comfortable. Excellent pool and beach facilities. Porters and breakfast staff helpful and attentive. Front desk staff rude and ignorant (all women) all have an attitude. To give an example on arrival my wife asked Brenda to put a valuable item just purchased from Tiffany in the hotel safe, her reply was give it to the porters. Another downer was the breakfast buffet, nothing like the typical american buffet you would normally associate with a major hotel. The guy next to us one day just refused to pay as it was so average. Overal impression ok for a short stay 1 or 2 days fine, more than that it will wind you up.......
reviews.title: Poor service Brenda.....

reviews.text: Frozen rum drinks are only $8, delicious mafongo lunch special only $9.95. Excellent coffee, and concierge.
reviews.title: Rum, mafongo & ocean breeze

reviews.text: We just got back from a 10 day vacation at the InterContinental San Juan Resort. I would strongly recommend this hotel to others. The staff is friendly and helpful and if you have any questions go to the hotel concierge Nestor he is the greatest and very helpful. If you are going to Old San Juan take the bus not a taxi it is only .75 cents on the bus one way and 20.00 dollars one way with a taxi. Do not take a tour to the Bacardi Rum Factor very pricey I believe around 63.00 per person. You can go by yourself take a bus for .75 cents and the ferry over to the factory is .50 cents and the taxi to the factory is 3.00 dollars a person one way. I would also recommend going to Walgreens which is about 1/4 of a mile left of the hotel to save big bucks. The food and drinks are very expensive in the Hotel. $8.00 dollars for a beer and $12.00 for a mixed drink. You can save alot by going down the street. Also there is a Pueblo Market close by also. The Bio Bay was fantastic I would recommend this also. Again if any questions go to Nestor he is very helpful. Hope this helps.
reviews.title: Overall experience of our vacation

reviews.text: After reading the range of reviews of this hotel, my wife and I were somewhat concerned. We just returned from a 5 day/ night stay from 2/5-2/9. Overall,our stay was very pleasant-most of the staff seemed sincerely interested in providing a high level of friendly customer service-with afew exceptions. Our check-in took twenty minutes because the front desk clerk disappeared into the office for 15 minutes without an explanation either before or after. It took an hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room from downstairs and there was no safe in our room. The room also seemed dated and the bathtub grout was less than pristine. However, the pool was magnificent and the front door staff was genuine and friendly.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here October of 2011 as we got a really good deal via Cheap Caribbean other wise we probably wouldn't have gone down. The hotel was an older property however they've done a really good job with the updates and maintenance. The pool was very fun and located right beside the beach which is my favorite set-up. The property has a very nice beach out front and the water was terrifically warm. The water was very rough a couple days which worked up a ton of seaweed so that wasn't real fun but we made do! They have a gentleman you can pay to put beach chairs out for you which was fantastic.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for the price we got

reviews.text: We didn't eat at the property as their prices were beyond ridiculous. And if there was anything I would say bad about the whole area is the food!!! I generally can eat anything but I had some of the worst food I've ever had and it didn't matter where we ate with the exception of breakfast. We found a wonderful little diner down the road that did a good job. I'm sorry I guess I'm spoiled with the Mexican food we love from the Riveria Maya.
reviews.title: Great spot for a getaway

reviews.text: We were within walking distance to a large grocery store, pharmacies, party stores etc. so was very nicely located. If we had to do over now that we've been there we would stay down near Old San Juan but for our first time this was a good selection. So over all a good property, not perfect but for the price we paid perfectly acceptable.
reviews.title: unkept promises

reviews.text: Amazing pool, great beach and a very nice lobby. Friendly staff at every turn and outstanding concierge service. Rooms need a little work but overall a great stay. Not much to do around the area and quite a hike into Old San Juan ($25 cab each way) but the resort was well worth the trip.
reviews.title: Intercontinental

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading all of these reviews, we went to the IC San Juan with pretty low expectations knowing that it wasn't going to blow us away but it would be a great place just to get away for four nights and get some sun and relaxation. But from the moment arrived, it was one problem after another.
reviews.title: A Series of Unfortunate Events

reviews.text: We got to the hotel at 12:30pm on Thursday and being Ambassador Members, we are able to check in early if the room is ready. The room wasn't ready but the snide front desk man told us it would be ready no later than 4:00pm but to check in with him around 3:00pm. We grabbed some lunch but didn't want to change into our suits because we figured it wouldn't take too long to get to our room. So, we wasted time, got some groceries across the street, and checked back at 2:50pm. He said the room wasn't ready yet and to check back in another half hour. 3:30pm we went back and he gave my boyfriend some very different news. The front desk admitted to him that our room had been taken by a flight crew and since their flight was delayed out of San Juan, they got the room until it was ready for them to head back to the airport. They told us it would be no later than 6:30pm.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time

reviews.text: Yes, 6:30pm. So, after a morning of flying, three hours of wasting time, they now tell us that it would be another 3 hours until we were able to check in. My boyfriend came outside with this news to me and I went back in to talk to the manager. She was the most unapologetic manager I had ever encountered. She kept telling me that she had another room for us, but it was lower than the room class we reserved and we didn't want that room. We wanted the room class that had been promised to us when we checked in that afternoon. She offered nothing more than "There's nothing else I can do for you, you're going to have to wait until these people leave your room". After five minutes of this conversation that got nowhere, I finally told her that I was frustrated with her customer service and that usually in circumstances like this, you say "Let me give you breakfast or here some gambling vouchers, I'm sorry this has been hard but I'm trying to make it up to you." She replied "Well, I didn't know if you liked breakfast. What are you looking for?" I told her that since she saw our reservation the next night at Ruth Chris, she should pick up the bill as a sign of good-will. She put a cap of $200 on the bill and then further added "That $200 is for food only. You will pay for liquor and taxes and tip.” We finally changed into our suits and sat around until 6:30pm. The room still wasn't ready. We got into our room at 7:30pm that night.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the Intercontinental

likes.disliked: — Not very much going on in the immediate surrounding area

reviews.text: Our TV wasn't working when we finally got to our room. We called and they sent someone up to reprogram it. That wasted another 15 minutes. We called it a night and went to bed. Friday was a good day other than the fact that they didn't put down "couple's massage" for the $360 massage package we got and they led us into separate rooms. I spoke up and they took us back to the waiting room to wait ten minutes until the couple's room was set up. We got back to the room after the massage to sleep and 5 minutes later, the fire alarm went off. We walked down the 8 flights just to be told at the bottom that it was just a drill and to go back upstairs.
reviews.title: Not quite a 4 star, but decent enough.

reviews.text: Sunday morning we pulled the tv out on the tv tray to watch from bed and (I kid you not) the tv wasn't screwed into the tray so this tv came tumbling down to the ground smashing on the floor. We had to call downstairs, they sent up security, then an insurance guy to take pictures, and then we had to sit and wait until another tv came up. He said it was all set. When we went to try it, the remote didn't work and we had to call again to have someone reprogram the tv.
reviews.title: Weekend Getaway at Intercontinental

likes.disliked: — steep drink/food prices, workout room needs upgrade

reviews.text: What a paradise, stayed there while on business with the military, govt rate of 195. Right on the water with its own beach and casino. The rooms had couch and coffee table, rooms from the 10th floor up have a great view of the ocean. Food and drinks are expensive, 8-10 bucks for a rum and coke. Grocery store across street. Eat at Lupi's a few blocks down, mexican sports bar-great fajitas.
reviews.title: Absolutely paradise..perfect in evry way!!

reviews.text: Just returned from a long girl's weekend at the Intercontinental. We had orginally booked the El San Juan but after reading all the terrible reviews, we changed. We were checked into our rooms with no problems even though it was only noon (the people who work here are extremely nice). The room was fine (we were on the city side). Nicely sized, clean and the beds were pretty comfortable. The bathroom is very small but there's a seperate area with a mirror and outlets that's very useful. Like some other reviews mentioned, the walls are very thin, you can hear everything in the hallways, but it was never an issue while we were there.
reviews.title: Just returned from long weekend

reviews.text: The pool area is very nice, a little wear and tear here and there but they keep the area very clean. We never had any problems getting chairs together and there is a lot of shade for those who don't want to be in the sun all day. From what I understand, they're starting a pool rennovation on September 5th. We didn't spend much time on the beach but the area in front of the hotel had the softest sand I've ever felt and the waves were nice and calm.
reviews.title: Would Return to the InterContinental San Juan Resort In A Minute!

reviews.text: By the pool there is the pool bar (the rum punch is really good) and a restaurant between the pool and beach that's good for lunch. A word to the wise- the drinks are kind of pricey. It cost $46 a pop for the four of us to get drinks so it starts to add up. But if you're inclined, you can walk across the street to the market and buy a whole bottle of rum for $12.
reviews.title: nice place lousy location

reviews.text: We ate at the sushi restaurant the first night and it was so-so. The other nights we went to the Parrot Club in OSJ (always a favorite) and then to the Palm at the El San Juan next door, also very good.
reviews.title: It was really great!
Here we are again
reviews.text: This hotel has become our favorite when coming to the SJ Metro area. Every time we have been very pleased with the location and friendliness of their staff.
The only con is that food is really expensive. You have to take a short walk around the hotel to find nice cheaper alternatives.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: And this time we were given room 401 which was right on top of where the construction crews working on the renovations do most of their work. Since 7 am on a Saturday we have been hearing noises: drillers, trucks, etc.
reviews.title: Fun in the sun

reviews.text: We feel dissapointed. We came here for a weekend escape in which we could stay in the room vegging like broccoli and had to run away because of the noise.
reviews.title: Nice hotel. Expensive to eat there.

reviews.text: Had a great experience went for a 3 day trainning, service was great ,loved the pool ,Rooms very confortable. There was remodeling but dint affect my review . The casino small but good.Staf very friendly .Rest. were great .There are plenty of food options around the hotel within walking distance.
reviews.title: Intercontinental hotel San Juan Puerto Rico

reviews.text: Any other questions feel free to email me,
reviews.title: Adequate hotel on the beach

reviews.text: My friends and I had booked on-line. A friend recommended the hotel because of the beautiful pool and swim up bar. When we arrived, we were informed that we should have been told when we booked (we weren't) that the pool was closed for renovations and instead we could take a shuttle bus to the Holiday Inn's pool. We were offered our choice of a few amenities - casino credits, free breakfast, a 30 min massage, etc. Since the reason we had booked there was the pool, we decided to go elsewhere and ended up at the beautiful El San Juan.
reviews.title: Looked nice, too bad the pool was closed

likes.liked: — They didn't tell us the pool would be closed. I guess that is why the rate was so good.
likes.disliked: — Call them to confirm details if you book on line

reviews.text: I will not repeat all the good things other people talked about already, just add that they will go out of the way to satisfy you, on our first day, the room was ready 15 min later than 4pm, which was really not a big deal, I did not even said anything, sure enough, they apologize and gave us a free breakfast for the following day ($60 for 3), then, on our forth day, we got wrong info about a place we went to, again, we did not ask for anything, they took off our bill all the parking charges (3 days) for the rental car we had.
reviews.title: A bit worn, but all of the amenities

likes.liked: — Very pretty beachside and great food

reviews.text: Also, there is an Avis rental car desk in the lobby, Maria, the supervisor was also very helpful and extremely nice.
reviews.title: Intercontinental was Outstanding!
we didn't want to leave
reviews.text: We already planning to go there again, we enjoyed it very much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the pictures and description on the web site I was expecting more luxurious accomidations. The walls were very thin, the furniture a bit worn. The bathroom was small. It had a nice balcony for city view. I was on 5th floor and didn't hear much traffic with door closed. Service was very nice, and really enjoyed the tours booked with the hotel. The bed was quite comfortable, mini-bar was a bit sparce for selections. Free Wireless access was nice. The room service food and the Yokahama restaurant were both excellent.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon

likes.liked: — The pool, the staff, the beach, and the general location
likes.disliked: — I didn't find much to be unhappy about. The walls were a little thin, but it never bothered me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I planned a 8 day vacation in late July and loved it so much we extended the stay 4 more days. Even better, we returned 2 weeks later for 10 more days! The pool area has a beautiful layout, one of the better pools in the San Juan area. The pool atmosphere is laid back and relaxing with a touch of a party atmosphere. We had an ocean view room for both trips, and what a view it is! The room was clean, comfortable, and freezing! The lobby renovations that where going on did not bother us a bit as we where more excited with anticipation of what we would see on our next visit to IC.
reviews.title: We couldn't get enough so we went back

reviews.text: We both enjoy gambling very much as I am an avid blackjack player. The IC has the best/player friendly BJ game in the area, bar none. I played at ALL the area casinos and it's not even close rules wise. The casino staff is super friendly and actually want you to win, unlike the miserable staff located next door. Speaking of staff, you must see Michael Rodriguez and Aida Alcazar as soon as you visit, you will not meet 2 more genuine casino staffers anywhere. Edguardo is a great floor person and his fun personality made us feel welcome. Aida goes out of her way to make your experience extremely pleasurable and it is so natural to her, ask her anything!!....Thanks Aida!
reviews.title: Awesome pool and swim up bar...what more do you want in an island resort

reviews.text: Visitors please note that if you are going to gamble, again see Aida and get a players club card. All points earned on your table play can be used for restaurants, and other necessities. At time of check-out you can use your comp. points towards your bill. Their comp. rating system is very generous, best on the Island, even better than the Connecticut casinos i visit and you do not need to be a high roller!
reviews.title: Great value and great views!
Nice beach hotel
reviews.text: If you like the beach, pool, and gambling then the IC is the place for you. If you like to get out and see more, see James G (unofficial concierge) at the door and he will point you in the right direction! Super friendly staff (we have never been said "hello" to or "good morning" so many times in our life!) who make sure that your stay is top notch. We can't wait to get back to IC!
Again, Aida, thanks for everything and we will see you soon!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

aka: Intercontinental San Juan Hotel Isla Verde
description: The beachfront InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino is located on Isla Verde and is a great setting for both business and pleasure. With the best sparkling beach of the area, perfect weather, amazing restaurants, natural beauty, fun and adventure, sizzling nightlife and great shopping your stay will sure be a memorable one. San Juan International airport is just three miles away. Conducting business is a breeze and it's easy to balance with pleasure. During the day, your group can enjoy our flexible meeting spaces and executive breakout rooms. Our team of experts will orchestrate the finer points, while you sit back in pampered elegance. Old San Juan and the main financial and business districts are just 15 minutes away. Nature lovers will not want to miss El Yunque Rain Forest, The Rio Camuy Caves or the Bioluminescent Bay. Free children, free Wi-Fi are just a few of the perks. Do more than just visit an exotic place; immerse yourself in it. Stay at InterContinental San Juan Resort & Casino and allow us to pamper you with our warm hospitality.
